sentences.en: He is exalted to the position of chief manager.
sentences.cn: 他被提升到总经理的地位.

sentences.en: He was exalted to the position of president.
He was exalted to the postion of a general manager of the company.
sentences.cn: 他被提升为公司的总经理.

sentences.en: He was exalted to the skies.
I felt shy in such exalted company.
sentences.cn: 我与如此显贵的人在一起觉得拘束。

sentences.en: Keep it to yourself if you feel exalted.
sentences.cn: 假如你感到高兴,那就留给你自己吧.

sentences.en: She was exalted over him, before the Lord.
sentences.cn: 在上帝面前,她比他更高贵.

sentences.en: The manager exalted many of his friends.
sentences.cn: 经理提拔了他的许多朋友.

sentences.en: The performance truly exalted the audience.
sentences.cn: 演出确使观众情绪高昂.

sentences.en: The retiring professor was exalted by his colleagues.
sentences.cn: 这位即将退休的教授受到了同事们的赞扬.

sentences.en: The victorious students ran through the street in an exalted state of excitement.
sentences.cn: 得胜的学生们兴高采烈地跑过大街.

sentences.en: They were exalted by the news of the victory.
sentences.cn: 他们因听到胜利的消息而兴高采烈.

sentences.en: Truth and honesty have their claims to be honored and exalted.
sentences.cn: 忠诚老实、光明磊落的人也应该获得荣誉,受到尊敬.

sentences.en: We were exalted by his poems.
sentences.cn: 他的诗激发了我们的想象力.

sentences.en: You must decide how to make the best use of your exalted position.
sentences.cn: 你必须弄清楚如何充分利用自己显要的地位。

words.tran_cn: 得意洋洋，欣喜；提拔；举起

trans.tran_cn: 高贵的，高尚的，崇高的，意气风发的，兴奋的，得意洋洋的
trans.tran_en: having a very high rank and highly respected

trans.tran_cn: 赞扬( exalt的过去式和过去分词)，歌颂，提升，提拔，使激动
